Here is my newly designed rover

It can spin out of control and still survive, had some test runs on Kerbin an it started spinning and hopping around at more than 50m/s on the ground and nothing broke ^^

If you start rolling and want the up side up again you can just retract the lading gear, roll and voila!

You can use RCS or the rockter at the back to move it

Edited August 27, 2012 by hollyghost
Awesome, love the car look of it
After spaceplanes we now have space cars! ^^

That looks pretty wow.

ALL THE WHEELS. XD

Love it. still working at making a functioning rover.

My stock rover has two wheels on bottom and two on top, at 90 degree angles, even so it has occasional clearance issues with the terrain and scrape the bottom.

Do you think your rover is stable over terrain because it has good clearance on the bottom?

Didn't have any issues yet. I noticed I go "into" the ground from time to time when there is a little elevation but usually it never goes any higher then the wheels and I think it's just a bug.

And what do you mean by stable? It happens that it tips over the the side so I don't have the up-side of my craft to be paralell to the ground but even then you can still control it or just stop and turn it over again

And I also tried going up and down hills, and it works! ^^
This reminds me of segaprophet's Lynx ROV.
